title: Registered Nurse, BSN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Baptist Health System (Texas) (San Antonio, TX) in Jan 2023
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was very easy. Most units just explained the unit, how things worked, and what they expected. They asked a few questions about me and why I wanted to work there. It was overall a very easy experience!
Interview Questions: Tell me a little bit about yourself.

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Baptist Health System (Texas)
Interview Descriptions: I applied and received a call back the next day. Interview was set up within a week.  I haven't interviewed yet but glassdoor forced me to so heres the review lol
Interview Questions: haven't interviewed yet but process seems quick so far

title: Physical Therapist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Baptist Health System (Texas) (San Antonio, TX)
Interview Descriptions: Multiple  face-to-face or zoom meetings with Admin team and Hiring clinic staff . Generic interview questions. Easy to moderate interview difficulty pending how comfortable you are speaking to groups .
Interview Questions: Describe a time when you felt overwhelmed with your workload. How did you respond?

title: New Grad RN Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Baptist Health System (Texas)
Interview Descriptions: The interview was pretty straight forward; I got asked behavioral questions as well as a scenario question. The interviewer was nice and very informative. The interview lasted about 30 minutes.
Interview Questions:
Where do you want to be in 3yrs?
Why did you choose this hospital?

title: New Grad RN Position Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Baptist Health System (Texas)
Interview Descriptions: I interviewed in a room with two nurses. One being a manager and it was a very relaxed interview. They asked about 6 different questions and then yoi were able to ask any questions you had in mind.
Interview Questions: What are your best qualities?

title: Patient Care Associate Interview
Application Type: The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Baptist Health System (Texas) (San Antonio, TX) in Oct 2019
Interview Descriptions: I went to a hiring event and I got interviewed by a really nice nurse . After the interview was finished I got hired the same day and I was told that HR will contact me for the position (which they did ) .
Interview Questions: Why did you apply for this position?

title: Patient Care Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Baptist Health System (Texas) (San Antonio, TX) in Aug 2019
Interview Descriptions: I went to a hiring event where I interviewed with two nurses. The nurses asked me several questions then told me they would be in touch by the next business day. I was called for a second interview then was offered the job within that same week.
Interview Questions: Do you have any patient care experience?

title: Staff RN Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Baptist Health System (Texas) (San Antonio, TX) in Dec 2018
Interview Descriptions: I interviewed with director then nurse manager and finally a peer interview. process was quick, over a matter of days. The questions asked were standard for a nursing interview. Overall it was a good experience.
Interview Questions: Conflict resolution, describe a conflict with coworker and how it was resolved

title: Patient Care Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Baptist Health System (Texas) (San Antonio, TX) in Sept 2018
Interview Descriptions: I attended their hiring event where they held  on the spot interviews. When arriving i signed in and then met with a recruiter that asked me about my experience and availability. I then waited about twenty minutes before I was called upon to interview. Overall it went great the two individuals interviewing me were very great and talking to me about the  type of work i would do and what they expect from an employee. We talked for about 20 minutes and they asked me only a few questions the rest of the time was spent talking about what their expectations and how they run their department. The interview was great however, i have not heard back yet. It has been a week.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work for this organization?

title: RN Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Baptist Health System (Texas)
Interview Descriptions: I received a call back from my online application and they asked if I was still interested in the job position. I said yes and hey set me up with a phone interview since I lived in another state. I was then Interviewed by phone with two people. They were very friendly and didn’t make it seem that much like an interview. It was short and they got the point across fairly well.
Interview Questions: The most memorable question they asked was, “what word would your past boss use to describe you?”

title: Patient Service Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Baptist Health System (Texas) in Apr 2017
Interview Descriptions: The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed two times in a week and they made the offer that same week. I applied online, got called the following week and was made an offer
Interview Questions:
Why Baptist
Where do you ser yourself in the company?

title: Buyer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 days. I interviewed at Baptist Health System (Texas) (San Antonio, TX) in Apr 2017
Interview Descriptions: It was in an older building connected to a hospital - it was hard to figure out exactly where I needed to go, but i figured it out and it wasn't bad at all. . . . . . . . . . . . . .
Interview Questions: Why do you want work for us?

title: Staff RN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Baptist Health System (Texas) (San Antonio, TX) in Mar 2016
Interview Descriptions: I was Interviewed by Manager of Unit before I was taken around and shown the unit briefly and introduced to staff, then taken to a panel of staff in a room and interviewed and questioned.
Interview Questions: Hypothetical questions with unit situations

title: RN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Baptist Health System (Texas) (San Antonio, TX) in Jun 2015
Interview Descriptions: I was interviewed by the Nurse manager and Director. I felt good during the interview process, no pressure at all. It was a typical nursing interview, nothing out of the ordinary.
Interview Questions:
Why nursing as a career? 
What does commitment mean to you? 
How do you deal with difficult situations?

title: Patient Access Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Baptist Health System (Texas) (San Antonio, TX) in Jun 2014
Interview Descriptions: applied online took them forever to contact for interview. They must get alot of applications. Had one interview and then a peer interview with 3 associates. took me on tour very nice...called in one day and told me i had the job....HR took forever to contact kept leaving messages to accept job offer.
Interview Questions: what are your strengths and weakness......

title: Registered Nurse, RN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at Baptist Health System (Texas) (San Antonio, TX) in Oct 2013
Interview Descriptions: The hiring process was actually a pleasant experience. The hiring staff were friendly and helpful, emailing paperwork ahead of time so I could have it all filled out and directions were very clear on exactly what I needed to bring to HR. The interview was friendly and not intimidating.
Interview Questions: Tell us why we should hire you.

title: Hospital Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Baptist Health System (Texas) (San Antonio, TX) in May 2013
Interview Descriptions: I initially contacted the CEO of BHC and asked if there were any internships available. A week later, I received a phone call from the CNO asking to meet with him in a few days. I obliged and met with him. He asked questions based on my resume. Once that was done, he offered me a position as an undergraduate analyst at their hospital.
Interview Questions: There were no difficult or unexpected questions. Everything was based on my resume. I was asked to elaborate on certain skill sets I included in it.

title: Staff RN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Baptist Health System (Texas) (San Antonio, TX) in Feb 2013
Interview Descriptions: It was super easy and relaxed. Called in with other applicants at one time and met all the floor managers, then answered a questionaire. Met superviser, and walked around unit. Met with one of the unit nurses. Asked questions.  Able to meet with HR and given an offer all in same day.
Interview Questions: How do you deal conflict, what do you like about nursing, how do you deal with difficult patients, and difficult staff. How would you deal with DRs, and errors. What is important to me as a nurse.

title: Pharmacy Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Baptist Health System (Texas) (San Antonio, TX) in Aug 2012
Interview Descriptions: Submitted application online with test, called for interview, scheduled, had interview with lead tech as well as two other technicians, then interviewed with supervisor, called back, scheduled for new hire training.
Interview Questions: What is your greatest weakness?

title: Executive Vice President Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Baptist Health System (Texas) (San Antonio, TX) in Mar 2012
Interview Descriptions: Individual interviews with peer executives in other service lines as well as with senior leadership.  Interviews with chief operating officer, VP HR.  Gallup interview, you will not be hired if you do not achieve acceptable score on the Gallup.  The leadership walks the talk for patient care and service excellence and the commitment is crystal clear from the CEO
Interview Questions: Current strategic and operational challenges

title: CNA Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Baptist Health System (Texas) (San Antonio, TX) in Jan 2012
Interview Descriptions: I got called to go into an interview. I had a one on one interview with the director of the floor and he offered me the job right there and then. The orientation process and everything else takes about 4-6 weeks.
Interview Questions: They asked about my experience.

title: Collector I Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Baptist Health System (Texas) (San Antonio, TX) in Dec 2011
Interview Descriptions: You interview with 3 or more people at the same time. It's a peer interview process and if your fellow co-workers like you then you will have a 2nd interview with the manager.
Interview Questions: Q: What is your biggest regret in life.

title: Certified Nurse Aide Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Baptist Health System (Texas) (San Antonio, TX) in Sept 2011
Interview Descriptions: First, I spoke with my director and we went over basic questions. Next, I was interviewed by the director and two other aides to determine if the would want me in their team. Finally, I was offered a schedule and mentorship until I was ready to hit the floor independently.
Interview Questions: How I would manage time between vitals and the lights.

title: Physician Relations Interview
Application Type: The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Baptist Health System (Texas) (San Antonio, TX) in May 2011
Interview Descriptions: The interviewer was late to the interview which was informal and over lunch. She did not value that I was in Grad school (an evening MBA program specializing in Healthcare Administration)  and pretty much blew me off when this came up. She told me she would be following up with me to schedule another interview. I sent a thank you note and email as well as a follow up call and never heard from her again. It is very unprofessional to treat people that way... If you don't like them, tell them why, if you don't value education don't act like you do, and don't lie to people about following up with them when you don't plan to...
Interview Questions: What would you like to eat?

title: Parking Cashier/Attendant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at Baptist Health System (Texas) (San Antonio, TX) in Jan 2011
Interview Descriptions: Written exam, and oral examination by Department Head, I meet with the Department Head and he conducted the written exam and the oral exam, checked my phone skills and took me on a tour of the hospital.
Interview Questions: The strangest question was if I stranded on an island, what 5 items would I want with me.

title: Pharmacy Tech Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at Baptist Health System (Texas) (San Antonio, TX) in Dec 2010
Interview Descriptions: the interview was standard, interviewed with the lead technician , then the pharmacy director, was offered job on the spot.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied through a staffing agency. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Baptist Health System (Texas) (San Antonio, TX) in Jun 2010
Interview Descriptions: was through a staffing company but it was great to know the department and hospital and the director was really helpful and approachable
Interview Questions: experience with ECG

title: Financial Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at Baptist Health System (Texas) (San Antonio, TX) in Aug 2009
Interview Descriptions: I had three interviews, Accounting Manager, Financial Analyst, and CFO.  The position required a versatile person because no two days were ever the same.  Time management skills were essential.  The most important aspect of the interview was to determine how I handled change and made adjustments.
Interview Questions: How would you explain productivity and finacial statements to doctors?

title: Intern Chaplain Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Baptist Health System (Texas) (San Antonio, TX) in Jul 2009
Interview Descriptions: They just wanted someone to cover their on call - anybody will do and
Interview Questions: N/A
